alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Roberts (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 31 at 11:54AM CDT until March 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the Blowing Dust Warning, localized to widespread blowing dust expected. Visibility is expected to drop to one-quarter mile or less. * WHERE...Dallam, Hartley, Hutchinson, Moore, and Roberts Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Severely limited visibilities are expected. Travel will be dangerous and possibly life-threatening.
info.instruction: Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, `Pull Aside, Stay Alive`. Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.
